Authors: María Mónica Ponce, M. Amalia Scataglini
Title:
Delimitation of Cheilanthes (Cheilanthoideae, Pteridaceae)
based on molecular phylogeny: the species included and a new genus in
South American
Keywords:
Cheilanthes Cheilanthoideae Mineirella Phylogeny South
America
Abstract:
The present analysis corroborate and expande our previous
phylogenetic results about the delimitation of Cheilanthes s.s..
including a larger sample of South American species and three plastidial
genes; this allowed us to resolve relations that up to now remained
unsolved or with low support. Here, we analyze 45 Cheilanthes species
(23 from South America) and circumscribe Cheilanthes s.s in a high
supported clade that contains three subclades: 1) Cheilanthes
exclusively from South America, 2) Cheilanthes from Australasia + South
America, and 3) Cheilanthes from Africa. On the other hand, the position
of three South American species belonging to the informal ‘Cheilanthes
geraniifolia group’, were confirmed as a high supported group outside
Cheilanthes s.s. and within the Doryopteris clade; this group was
established as the new genus Mineirella. The descriptions and
illustrations of Cheilanthes s.s. and Mineirella are provided. Also the
new combinations for the new genus and a key to its species are
available. Additionally, based on the phylogenetic relationships
obtained, we discussed the morphological adaptive innovations that
support the different clades.
